title: What do you think will happen at the end of The Eternals film? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve never read an Eternals comic. I couldn’t name one member of the team. But I have seen a Marvel movie, so I can pretty confidently guess what will happen. The climax will start with the team coming together. They will have had many obstacles towards working together efficiently along the way, but will finally come together for the greater good.  They will then have to fight the big bad guy and his disposable army in order to obtain a McGuffin. The fight will seem to be going great as the poorly written score that makes up their theme song plays in the background.  But then the villain will step in. Each member of the team will try to defeat him alone, but they will fail.  Only while working as a team will they be able to succeed.  They will then obtain the McGuffin and reaffirm their status as a team for the inevitable sequel.  Basically, it will consist of the normal trite shit that goes into a climax of a Marvel Movie.

They’ll all rip off their nano masks and reveal this was the real ending of Game of Thrones. Or the first X-Men movie. Most likely? There will be a commercial for High School Musical Meets Clarissa Explains it All: Nobody Gets Out Alive, because I don’t see this property making it to the big screen, so if the complete it, Disney streaming here is comes They are less known than the InHumans, who at least had a huge in-world push to replace mutants for several years in preparation for their movie, which became a TV show, which sucked. We’ve met an Eternal already. His name is Thanos. He was a dick. And if I have to sit through a montage of how the Celestials (big C) mucked about with sentient life all over the universe, leaving mainline beings, Deviants, and Eternals, and how on Earth there was a civil war among the Eternals so some left for Titan, moon of Saturn, and Thanos was one, but inherited a recessive Deviant gene while his bro got the date-rape gene, but on Earth, how weird, their names and powers were so similar to the Olympian Gods they acted as their Earthly Avatars until that went tits up, and Sersi joined the Avengers and fell in love with Jon Snow, even though he’s short, I’ll shove a straw in my eye. By the way, that’s the movie. Spoiler alert. I just saved you 30 dollars.

I think the film will be about the Civil War between the Eternals of whether they should conquer other races or not, but most of it will probably be the origins. I think it will end with Kro and the Deviants in an end credits scene, and then it will end. I’m not sure if it will explore the celestials or not, since I’m not the biggest expert on the Eternals, but expect Origins, and definitely an appearance from the Deviants, who are the Eternals’ biggest enemies. This will probably be a trilogy so I expect the Deviants to come in the second film. Sorry this answer wasn’t that helpful, but hopefully it’s better than nothing.

The Eternals will do a thing and a Bigger Bad will be watching. Though after Thanos I’m not sure why (if the rumours I’ve seen are true) marvel thinks that Kang the Conqueror would be a bigger bad. He just time travels and tries to control history, so if he succeeded nobody would notice except other time travelers and they’d stop him, which they must’ve already in the MCU otherwise he’d be the face of everything and mentioned already. given Far From Home and the twist there I’m not holding out hope that they might be nothing more than powerful illusions. Tbh, I have no idea and no guesses. Sorry.

The official synopsis confirms that Eternals will somewhat occur after Avengers: Endgame. SPOILERS HERE!! The movie will perhaps start at an archeological survey just like the comics.  The movie will also focus on Ikarris or other Eternals trying to bring the celestials back to Earth.  In the comics Ikarris uses a Cosmic Beacon left behind by the Celestials. In the end, or perhaps the post credit scene, maybe we could see Celestials coming to the Earth.  In the comic, we got the Origin Story in Eternals #001 but we got to see a Celestial at the end of Eternals #002.
